explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: No data available. Flash point of 40% solution: <=100degC, according to ICSC (2003)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gaseous substances are not available (boiling point: 50.4degC (Lide, 84th, 2003), test temperature: 55degC)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 200mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol.2 (2003)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 12,700mg/kg (CICAD 57 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4-hour inhalation exposure) value of 2.44mg/L (equivalent to 5,860ppm) (SIDS (2003)) was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (264,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 26.7kPa (20degC), the substance is "Not classified."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the human evidence of "moderate irritation," although the results of animal skin irritation tests indicate "severe irritation" (CERI Hazard Data 98-8 (1999), SIDS (2003)), "mild irritation" (CERI Hazard Data 98-8 (1999), SIDS (2003)), "erythema" (CICADS 57 (2004), "no irritation" (SIDS (2003)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on the rabbit eye irritation tests: "severe irritant" (CERI Hazard Data 98-8 (1999)); "severe erythema and mild edema of the conjunctiva, and inflammation and opacity of the iris were observed. The reactions resolved 1-2 weeks after exposure"; "severe conjunctival erythema/inflammation and iris inflammation/opacity" (SIDS (2003)). The substance is thus considered to cause severe irreversible irritation of the eye.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests performed based on the Buehler and Maximization Methods (SIDS (2003) and CERI Hazard Data 98-8 (1999)), and the human epidemiological evidence of "skin necrosis, erythema and edema." The substance is thus considered to cause "skin sensitization."

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus test), described in CERI Hazard Data 98-8(1999), SIDS (2003), NTP DB (Access on October 2005), CICAD 57 (2004).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as A4 by ACGIH (2001).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 2 (respiratory system, liver, heart, kidney, adrenal gland, nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (respiratory system, liver, heart, kidney, adrenal gland, nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "hemorrhage of the lung/liver/heart, congestion of the lung/gastrointestinal tract/adrenal, discoloration of the kidney, mottled discoloration of the liver, coma, piloerection" (SIDS (2003)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "epidermal hyperplasia of pharynx mucosal surface with infiltration of submucosal lymphocytes" (CERI Hazard Data 98-8 (1999)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96 hours LC50=86mg/L of the fish (Fathead Minnows) (SIDS (2003) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 65% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=-1.66 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
